page.title: 17HISTON & IMPINGTON
page.content: OFFICER OF CAMBRIDGESHIRE TO PROVIDE A FULL COMMUNITY EDUCATION FOR THE POPULATION OF THE NEIGBOURING VILLAGES TO STOP DRIFT OF POPULATION FROM COUNTRY INTO THE TOWN CENTRE.THE SCHOOL WAS DESIGNED BY A GERMAN ARCHITECT,{WALTER GROPIUS}AND OPENED IN SEPT.1939. {c)THE LAND IN HISTON:}THE LAND IN AND AROUND CAMBRIDGE IS VERY FLAT,AND IS USED MAINLY FOR ARABLE FARMING.THERE ARE VERY FEW HILLS AND NOT MANY WINDMILLS.THE LAND DRAINS FAIRLY WELL ALTHOUGH FLOODS DO OCCUR.HISTON IS AN IMPORTANT RESIDENTIAL AREA FOR CAMBRIDGE AND LONDON COMMUTERS.CHIVERS OWNS A LOT OF LAND IN THE VILLAGE AND THEY'VE BEEN IN HISTON SINCE 1820 WHEN A FARMER BEGAN TO SEND FRUIT TO LONDON HE CALLED THE BUSINESS CHIVERS.THE BUSINESS GREW VERY QUICKLY AFTER 1847 WHEN THE RAILWAY ARRIVED.
